title: Network
description: A telecommunication network. A network consists of a set of nodes interconnected by links.

identifier.title: Network identifier
identifier.description: A unique identifier for this network.

website.title: Website
website.description: The URL of the website for this network.

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: Information about the nodes that belong to this network.

nodesFile.title: Nodes file
nodesFile.description: A URI to identify the array of information about the nodes that belong to this network. To be used in place of `nodes` for very large datasets.

links.title: Links
links.description: Information about the links that belong to this network.

linksFile.title: Links file
linksFile.description: A URI to identify the array of information about the links that belong to this network. To be used in place of `links` for very large datasets.

phases.title: Phases
phases.description: Information about the phases in which this network is deployed.

organisations.title: Organisations
organisations.description: The organisations involved in this network. Organisation references elsewhere in the schema are used to refer back to this entries in this list.

contracts.title: Contracts
contracts.description: Information about the contracts for the development of this network.

collectionDate.title: Collection date
collectionDate.description: When the location data was collected. If a dataset was produced by digitising a map, the date that the data for the map was collected.

crs.title: Coordinate reference system
crs.description: The coordinate reference system used in the data. If this network includes any coordinate data (in `Node.location` or `Link.route`) then this field must be provided.

language.title: Language
language.description: The default language of the data, from the open language codelist. A [BCP47 language tag](https://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/) is allowed, if there is a user need for the additional information.

Node.title: Node
Node.description: A point within a network. A node may be an access point or may reflect a geographic point at which a link splits, aggregates or crosses a border. Nodes can allow for interconnections to other networks or connections to end users.

identifier.title: Node identifier
identifier.description: An identifier for this node. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the network this node belongs to.

location.title: Node location
location.description: The physical location of this node.

address.title: Node address
address.description: The physical address of this node.

internationalConnections.title: International connections
internationalConnections.description: The international connections available at this node.

accessPoint.title: Access point
accessPoint.description: Whether active or passive transmission equipment is installed at this node which is capable of providing access to the network.

type.title: Node type
type.description: The type of this node, using the open node type codelist.

technologies.title: Technologies
technologies.description: The active technologies used at this node, using the open node technologies codelist.

power.title: Power availability
power.description: Whether power for active network equipment is available at this node.

phase.title: Phase
phase.description: The phase to which this node belongs.

Link.title: Link
Link.description: A physical connection between two nodes.

identifier.title: Link identifier
identifier.description: An identifier for this link. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the network this link belongs to.

status.title: Link status
status.description: The status of the network infrastructure for this link.

endpoints.title: Endpoints
endpoints.description: The nodes that this link connects.

physicalInfrastructureProvider.title: Physical infrastructure provider
physicalInfrastructureProvider.description: The organisation that owns and maintains the passive network infrastructure, i.e. the non-electrical elements, such as dark fibre, ducts and physical sites.

networkProvider.title: Network provider
networkProvider.description: The organisation that operates the active network infrastructure, i.e. the electrical elements, such as optical transceivers, switches and routers.

transmissionMedium.title: Transmission medium
transmissionMedium.description: The transmission medium of this link, using the closed transmission medium codelist

deployment.title: Deployment
deployment.description: The physical deployment of this link, using the closed deployment type codelist.

darkFibre.title: Dark fibre availability
darkFibre.description: Whether access to dark fibre is available on this link.

fibreType.title: Fibre type
fibreType.description: The type of fibre used in this link, using the fibre type codelist.

fibreCount.title: Fibre count
fibreCount.description: The number of individual optical fibres in this link.

fibreLength.title: Fibre length
fibreLength.description: The physical length of fibre optic cable used in this link.

technologies.title: Technologies
technologies.description: The active technologies used on this link, using the open link technologies codelist.

capacity.title: Capacity
capacity.description: The transmission rate, or throughput, of this link, expressed in Gbit/sec (Gbps). The equipped capacity is the total capacity of the circuits (e.g. E1, DS3, STM-1 etc.) which have been activated in the network transmission equipment of the link.

readyForServiceDate.title: Ready for service date
readyForServiceDate.description: The date this link was ready to carry traffic.

phase.title: Phase
phase.description: The phases to which this link belongs.

country.title: Country
country.description: The countries in which this link is physically located, using the closed country code codelist.

Phase.title: Phase
Phase.description: A set of nodes and/or links deployed as a group.

identifier.title: Phase identifier
identifier.description: An identifier for this phase. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the network.

funders.title: Funders
funders.description: Information about the organizations that provide financing for the development or operation of this phase, also known as investors or financers.

id.title: Local identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this organisation.

role.title: Role
role.description: The organisation roles in this network, using the open organisation role codelist.

country.description: The country in which this organization is legally registered, using the closed country codelist.

listing.exchange.description: The market on which this organization is listed, using the ISO10383 market identifier codelist.

listing.symbol.description: The ticker symbol for this organization's market listing.

website.description: The URL of the website for this organization.

logo.description: The URL of the logo for this organisation.

OrganisationReference.title: Organisation reference
OrganisationReference.description: The id and name of the organisation being referenced. Used to cross-reference to the organisations section.

id.title: ID
id.description: The id of the organisation being referenced. This must match the id of an entry in the organisations section.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the organisation being referenced. This must match the name of an entry in the organisation section.

Value.title: Value
Value.description: The total upper estimated value of the procurement.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the amount, from the closed currency codelist.

streetAddress.title: Street address
streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

locality.title: Locality
locality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country in which the address is physically located, using the closed country code codelist.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: Organization identifiers should be taken from an existing organization identifier list. The scheme field is used to indicate the list or register from which the identifier is taken. This value should be taken from the Organization Identifier Scheme codelist.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier of the organisation in the selected scheme.

legalName.title: Legal name
legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organisation

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the organisation, such as those provided by Open Corporates or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organisation: that can be done through the URL field of the organisation contact point.

Contract.title: Contract
Contract.description: An agreement between the public and private sector to develop a network.

identifier.title: Contract identifier
identifier.description: An identifier for this contract. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the network.

dateSigned.title: Date signed
dateSigned.description: The date this contract was signed.

documents.title: Contract documents
documents.description: The documents related to this contract.

type.title: Type
type.description: The [GeoJSON geometry type](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#section-1.4) that is described by `.coordinates`, using the open geometry type codelist. This must be 'Point' when referenced by `Node.location`, and 'LineString' when referenced by `Link.route`.

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description:
One or more [GeoJSON positions](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.1). For geometries of type 'Point', the coordinates member must be a single position. For geometries of type 'LineString' the coordinates member must be an array of positions.

Each position is an array of numbers with two or more elements.  The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order. Longitude and latitude must be expressed using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84)[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#ref-WGS84] datum in units of decimal degrees. Altitude or elevation may be included as an optional third element and must be expressed as the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid

Therefore, geometries of type 'Point' must be a single array, e.g. [longitude, latitude], and geometries of type 'LineString' must be an array of arrays, e.g. [[longitude, latitude], [longitude, latitude]].

CoordinateReferenceSystem.title: Coordinate reference system
CoordinateReferenceSystem.description: The coordinate reference system used in the data.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the coordinate reference system.

uri.title: Uniform Resource Identifier
uri.description: A URI for the coordinate reference system.
